Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Job Description

Data Analyst (m/f/d)

THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.

THE ROLE We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our innovative and international Data & Insights team. By understanding the data needs of our stakeholders, you'll provide valuable insights and clear recommendations to support our data-driven decision-making process.

What You'll Do


Dive into complex marketing data sets to uncover trends and insights that drive key business decisions. Your work will have a direct impact on the strategy and growth of our group companies
Collaborate with a forward-thinking team that embraces the latest technologies and methodologies. We believe in continuous learning and innovation
Partner closely with team members and external business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making


Requirements

WHAT YOU'LL BRING


At least 3 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficient in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Marketing Data and Analytics, as well as Retail Media and Customer Analytics would be a big plus
Familiarity with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Strong abilities in generating reports using data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact
Fluent in German and English


What We Offer


Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year’s Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child’s sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to €1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
In house conversational German classes for beginners
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Premium relocation support for colleagues outside of Germany: visa application support, assistance with searching temporary accommodation, payment of the first monthly rent
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners
Show more

Title: Growth Data Analyst
Description:
Vivid is a dynamic fintech company dedicated to providing innovative solutions to enhance our users' financial experience. We are on a mission to identify and solve user problems, continuously improve our products, and introduce new features to make financial management simpler and more rewarding.

We recently launched our SME division, aiming to revolutionize how small and medium-sized enterprises grow and thrive in today's competitive landscape. We are seeking a highly motivated Growth Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will be passionate about driving growth, adept at analyzing data, and skilled at identifying opportunities to scale acquisition channels, optimize costs, and explore new avenues for expansion. This role is instrumental in shaping the growth strategy of our SME division and ensuring its long-term success.

In this role, you will:


Evaluate the cost-effectiveness of various acquisition channels and initiatives
Collaborate with team members to identify opportunities to scale high-performing acquisition channels
Research and evaluate emerging trends and technologies in the marketing and advertising landscape
Develop comprehensive dashboards and reports to track the effectiveness of different channels over time
Generate innovative ideas for new acquisition channels and tactics to reach target audiences



Requirements


Proficiency in SQL
Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Looker)
Basic knowledge of Python and willingness to develop these skills
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw actionable insights
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to articulate findings and recommendations to stakeholders at all levels
Team player with strong collaborative skills



Would be an advantage:


Experience in a growth-focused role, preferably in a startup or high-growth environment
Basic understanding of statistics and A/B testing
Understanding the architecture of Data Warehouse (DWH) layers



Benefits


We have a hybrid model in one of our offices, Berlin, Limassol, or Almaty, or fully remote outside office locations
We support relocation to Cyprus (visa, package) when needed
This is a senior-level position with a competitive salary and benefits package (depending on location)


If you're looking for an exciting new opportunity to take your analytical skills to the next level and make an impact in the world of finance, then Vivid is the perfect place for you. Come and join our talented team of professionals and help us revolutionize how people think about their money!
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Excited about AI?

Join us at ZDF Sparks and be part of an exciting journey in AI innovation! We are looking for a full-time Data Analyst (m/f/d) for our location in Berlin in a hybrid set-up at the earliest possible starting date.

Your Role

You join ZDF Sparks in its early growth phase to work on our customer projects around media planning, communication, distribution, and personalization. Your tasks include e.g.,


Analyse large datasets to uncover business insights and assess the feasibility of new AI applications
Evaluate data quality, data flows, and data architectures for AI applications
Collaborate with data science and ML engineering teams to design and optimize data flows in cloud-based AI solutions
Work closely with the client to define new AI solutions, particularly through workshops
Partner with DevOps / MLOps engineers to ensure optimized and scalable data infrastructure, data flows, and monitoring solutions


Your Profile


Strong background in data analytics for both structured and unstructured data, including the design and review of data architectures and flows for complex applications
Proficient in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI or Looker
Hands-on experience with SQL, Python and data manipulation tools like Pandas or PySpark
Skilled in analysis, visualization and design of complex data flows and architectures for cloud-based applications
Experience in designing AI applications in the cloud is an additional asset
Excellent communication and presentation skills for explaining technical concepts to non-technical audience as well as proven experience in conducting technical workshops with clients
A team player with a passion for AI and continuous learning
Fluent in both English and German


Our Commitment To You

ZDF Sparks is a workplace for curious, ambitious, and collaborative AI trendsetters who are excited about working on new and continuously changing customer challenges. We proudly embrace diversity and enjoy working in fast-paced cross-functional and multicultural teams.

Our hybrid office and mobile work model is designed to support personal flexibility and creativity, enabling a healthy work-life balance. We offer flexible working hours and a hybrid setup to accommodate any personal circumstances. In our centrally located Berlin top-floor office, we enjoy modern spaces with ergonomic workstations grouped to facilitate personal exchange and knowledge sharing, as well as closed rooms for larger meetings and quiet work.

We network with our ZDF office partners and visitors over lunches, talks, and afterwork get-together events; and engage in fun team activities during regular company events.

To support your professional growth, we offer opportunities for further education through (external) regular workshops and hackathons, and networking events. Additionally, we provide a professional development budget (per employee) for conferences, certifications, or external courses. The 30-day vacation rounds up the year to relax off the job.

Our Values

At ZDF Sparks, our values are the cornerstone of everything we do:


Transparent: We believe in clear, open communication both within our team and with our clients. Your insights and knowledge will be valued and shared to drive collective success.
Fun: We believe that work should be enjoyable and fulfilling. At ZDF Sparks, we maintain a light-hearted atmosphere with humor and a relaxed communication style among colleagues. This fosters a positive environment where everyone feels comfortable and motivated to contribute their best, ensuring our collaborative efforts are both productive and enjoyable.
Diverse: Our strength lies in our diverse team. Different perspectives and backgrounds drive our creativity and innovation, ensuring that our AI solutions are comprehensive and inclusive. By integrating different points of view, our collaborative team develops AI that reflects various experiences and meets the diverse needs of our clients.
Innovative: We live and breathe innovation, continuously learning and pushing boundaries to deliver cutting-edge AI solutions.


Any Questions?

Your contact person is: Nilofer Qayumi (Senior Technical Recruiter)

For any questions about the job advertisement and the application process, please contact career@zdf-sparks.com.

We look forward to getting to know you!


At ZDF Sparks, diversity drives our innovation and strengthens our team. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment where every individual feels valued and respected. We welcome applications from all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, or any other legally protected status.


About Us

ZDF Sparks was founded in 2024 - our data experts are an agile team dedicated to the development of AI solutions and algorithms for the media industry. We are focused on consulting, design and implementation of AI services, especially in the areas of algorithms, machine learning and data platforms for planning, communication, distribution and personalization of data and audiovisual content.

We are the perfect place for curious, ambitious and collaborative AI trendsetters who are excited about working on new and changing challenges. We enjoy working in our fast-paced, cross-functional and diverse team where everyone feels comfortable and can fulfill their full potential.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst with a focus on Power BI
Description:
Our Berlin and Munich offices are expanding! Do you want to be our future data colleague?

Data is one of Solita’s four areas of expertise. We have more than 400 data specialists, and our knowledge portfolio contains a variety of data-related specializations involving data solutions in a lot of technologies, both in the cloud and otherwise. In Solita, you will be part of a team that is courageous and passionate, but at the same time easy-going.

As the German market is a cornerstone of our growth strategy in West Europe, we are strengthening our German team with new Data colleagues. You will be working in our Berlin or Munich offices (Hybrid of course) where everything is in place to make your working day meaningful: coffee chats, office dogs, and apéro with colleagues at the end of the day.

Where Your Expertise Is Needed


Rollout Power BI Service as data visualization solution
Setting up, configure and maintain Power BI Service (e.g. Workspaces, Access Control, Data Sources Connectivity)
Building semantic models for reports and dashboards
Building data visualizations
Guiding clients on their digital transformation journey towards cloud native data visualization



What We Are Looking For


Expert in end-to-end Power BI Service ownership (setup, rollout, maintain, utilize)
Expert expertise in SQL, DAX and M
Expert in data modelling (semantic modelling) in Power BI
Native in German and good English knowledge



What We Offer


Challenging, impactful projects to work with
Nordic work culture of trust, responsibility, and maximum freedom
Individual benefit packages that suit your personal needs
Learning and career growth opportunities
A Scandinavian company culture mixed with German culture: read more



We believe the diversity of ideas and backgrounds gives us the creativity to be successful in a rapidly changing world. In support of this, we stress equality of opportunity for all qualified individuals in accordance with applicable laws. Decisions on hiring, promotion, development, compensation, or advancement are based solely on a person’s qualifications, abilities, experience, and performance.

Interested in hearing more?

We want to hear from you and figure out together what works best for us both. Tell us about yourself and your background in your own words.  Unfortunately, currently we cannot offer relocation for candidates outside Europe.

Our recruitment consists of 3 rounds of interviews where you will meet our team and learn more about working at Solita.

If you would like to hear more about working at Solita, please contact our recruiter Pauline Roy-Malikian: pauline.roy-malikian@solita.be
Show more

Title: Data Analyst/Market Researcher
Description:
Job Description

Responsibilities:


Conduct in-depth market research to identify industry trends, competitive landscapes, and growth opportunities.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights and inform business decisions.
Develop and maintain comprehensive databases and dashboards to track key performance indicators and metrics.
Generate reports, presentations, and visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop strategies and initiatives based on research findings.
Stay current on market developments, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and market research.


Requirements:


Bachelor’s degree in business, economics, statistics, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
Proven experience as a data analyst, market researcher, or similar role, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw meaningful conclusions.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with a commitment to producing high-quality work.
Effective communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences.
Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote environment.


What We Offer:


Competitive salary and benefits package, including health insurance and retirement savings options.
Flexible work schedule and the opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in the United States.
Professional development opportunities, including training and certifications to support your career growth.
A supportive and collaborative team environment where your contributions are valued and recognized.
Show more

  • Generate reports, presentations, and visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.

Title: Senior Growth Data Analyst
Description:
Our mission? Making day-to-day banking easier for SMEs and freelancers thanks to an online business account that's combined with invoicing, bookkeeping and spend management tools. Thanks to its innovative product, highly reactive 24/7 customer support and clear pricing, Qonto has become the leader in its market.

Our journey: Founded by Alexandre and Steve in July 2017, Qonto has rapidly gained trust, serving over 500,000 customers. Thanks to our wonderful team of 1,600+ Qontoers, we also made it to the LinkedIn Top Companies French ranking!

Our values:

Customer focus | Prioritize customers in everything you do

Ownership | Own your part, get things done

Teamwork | Make (team)work easy

Mastery | Continuously raise the bar

Integrity | Always do what’s right, and respect people

Our beliefs: At Qonto, we're committed to fostering a welcoming environment where everyone can thrive. We prioritize evaluating applicants based solely on skills and potential, ensuring diversity with 50% international team members, 44% women, and 20% parents. Join us in building a workplace that celebrates diversity and individuality.

Discover the steps we took to create a discrimination-free hiring process .

At Qonto, Data Analytics is essential and central to our business. You will join a team of talented data analysts, that provides key insights used to make strategic decisions across the company.

The BI Team is organized into three teams working in distinct areas, that regularly work together on cross-functional topics.

As a Growth Data Analyst, You will work closely with the growth department, supporting them by monitoring performance, building monitoring tools, and providing self-service analytics for understanding client acquisition metrics. Your insights will directly influence strategies to drive Qonto's expansion and success in the European market.

👩‍💻🧑‍💻As a Data Analyst at Qonto, you will :


Monitor performance and build robust monitoring tools to track key growth metrics
Conduct in-depth analyses of abnormalities in performance, both positive and negative, to uncover actionable insights
Perform ad hoc analyses to understand why certain issues occur and provide data-driven recommendations
Develop and maintain self-service analytics tools for the growth team to understand client acquisition metrics
Collaborate closely with stakeholders across the growth department, acting as a true business partner to provide insights and challenge strategies
Advocate for the team’s work to meet internal standards for code style, quality, maintainability, and best practices.


🚧 The Growth Data Analyst main mission:


Our Data Analyst Growth are here to empower Qonto's growth team with data-driven insights and help them acquire more high-value clients, particularly focusing on moving from freelancers and smaller companies to bigger companies.


🤔 What You Can Expect


Market/Team Context: You'll join a diverse and experienced growth team of five people, geographically distributed across Spain, Paris, and Germany. The team has a mix of experience levels, including a staff member, one level three, and three-level two employees.
Methodologies: We value autonomy, quick learning, and strong relationship building with partners and stakeholders. You'll need to adapt your communication style to different stakeholders' preferences.
Challenges: You'll work with data that is not always well-modeled or readily available, requiring creative problem-solving and the ability to work with raw data. You'll also need to prove value to stakeholders who may have had mixed experiences with BI in the past.
Tools: Proficiency in data visualization tools like Tableau is essential, as you'll be building dashboards autonomously.


🤝 About Your Future Manager

You will work closely with Omar , our Lead Data Analysts.

His background:

With his Data Science Engineering degree Omar was the first Data Analytics lead at Qonto and grew the team from 4 to 25 talented individuals. He partnered with the Product, Growth, Strategy, Finance, and People departments over the past 3 years. Before joining Qonto, Omar always worked in the Data field in different data-heavy industries such as the airline industry focusing on Revenue Management and the ad tech industry specifically on Sales Performance optimization.

What can he bring to you and the team?

Omar can offer strategic data leadership and analytics expertise to elevate the team's capabilities, infusing a robust data-informed culture that drives innovative product development and sharpens our competitive edge in the marketplace. Their collaborative approach and dedication to mentorship will not only enhance your technical proficiency but also foster a shared vision for success across the entire organization.

🏅About You


Experience: You have a strong background in growth analytics, particularly in areas like onboarding or website analytics. Experience in fintech or B2B is preferred.
Mastery: You excel at root cause analysis, impact measurement, and providing actionable recommendations based on data insights.
You have a strong Business Sense, you can challenge and define the business Value of a project and have the ability to leverage it to inform analysis and recommendations.
Strong relationship-building skills with partners and stakeholders
You’ve got a strong experience in building interactive dashboards and selecting the right type of visualization to convey the message behind the data. You understand user interface and user experience principles to create dashboards that are easy to use, accessible to various stakeholders, and most importantly, actionable
You’re not afraid of learning new tools if they serve your goal. You probably already know Python, SQL, and Tableau (or a similar dashboarding tool) and look forward to adding new skills to your belt.
A statistical background is a plus: you differentiate an anomaly in data from statistical noise.
Other traits and skills we are looking for include accountability, energy, a hands-on mindset (when needed), and framing problems/situations sharply.


At Qonto we understand that true diversity isn't just about ticking boxes on a hiring checklist. Apply regardless of the boxes you tick! Who knows? You may have the missing piece of the puzzle we've been searching for all along.

🎁 Perks

A tailor-made and dynamic career track. An inclusive work environment. And so much more to help you succeed.


Offices in Paris, Berlin, Milan, Barcelona, and Belgrade;
Tailor-made remote work policy depending on the job you apply for and where you live;
Competitive salary package;
A meal voucher;
Public transportation reimbursement (part or global);
A great health insurance (depending on the country);
Employee well-being initiatives: access to Moka Care to take care of your mental health and great offers for sports and wellness activities;
A progressive disability and parenthood policy (1 in 6 of Qonto employees is a parent!) and childcare benefits with selected partners;
Monthly team events.


💪 Our hiring process:


Interviews with your Talent Acquisition Manager and future managers
A remote exercise to demonstrate your skills and give you a taste of what working at Qonto could be like


We will send you an interview guide so you can best prepare yourself.

On average, our process lasts 20 working days and offers usually follow within 48 hours 🤞

HTML:
Our mission? Making day-to-day banking easier for SMEs and freelancers thanks to an online business account that's combined with invoicing, bookkeeping and spend management tools. Thanks to its innovative product, highly reactive 24/7 customer support and clear pricing, Qonto has become the leader in its market.

Our journey: Founded by Alexandre and Steve in July 2017, Qonto has rapidly gained trust, serving over 500,000 customers. Thanks to our wonderful team of 1,600+ Qontoers, we also made it to the LinkedIn Top Companies French ranking!

Our values:

Customer focus | Prioritize customers in everything you do

Ownership | Own your part, get things done

Teamwork | Make (team)work easy

Mastery | Continuously raise the bar

Integrity | Always do what’s right, and respect people

Our beliefs: At Qonto, we're committed to fostering a welcoming environment where everyone can thrive. We prioritize evaluating applicants based solely on skills and potential, ensuring diversity with 50% international team members, 44% women, and 20% parents. Join us in building a workplace that celebrates diversity and individuality.

Discover the steps we took to create a discrimination-free hiring process .

At Qonto, Data Analytics is essential and central to our business. You will join a team of talented data analysts, that provides key insights used to make strategic decisions across the company.

The BI Team is organized into three teams working in distinct areas, that regularly work together on cross-functional topics.

As a Growth Data Analyst, You will work closely with the growth department, supporting them by monitoring performance, building monitoring tools, and providing self-service analytics for understanding client acquisition metrics. Your insights will directly influence strategies to drive Qonto's expansion and success in the European market.

👩‍💻🧑‍💻As a Data Analyst at Qonto, you will :

  • Monitor performance and build robust monitoring tools to track key growth metrics
  • Conduct in-depth analyses of abnormalities in performance, both positive and negative, to uncover actionable insights
  • Perform ad hoc analyses to understand why certain issues occur and provide data-driven recommendations
  • Develop and maintain self-service analytics tools for the growth team to understand client acquisition metrics
  • Collaborate closely with stakeholders across the growth department, acting as a true business partner to provide insights and challenge strategies
  • Advocate for the team’s work to meet internal standards for code style, quality, maintainability, and best practices.

🚧 The Growth Data Analyst main mission:

  • Our Data Analyst Growth are here to empower Qonto's growth team with data-driven insights and help them acquire more high-value clients, particularly focusing on moving from freelancers and smaller companies to bigger companies.

🤔 What You Can Expect

  • Market/Team Context: You'll join a diverse and experienced growth team of five people, geographically distributed across Spain, Paris, and Germany. The team has a mix of experience levels, including a staff member, one level three, and three-level two employees.
  • Methodologies: We value autonomy, quick learning, and strong relationship building with partners and stakeholders. You'll need to adapt your communication style to different stakeholders' preferences.
  • Challenges: You'll work with data that is not always well-modeled or readily available, requiring creative problem-solving and the ability to work with raw data. You'll also need to prove value to stakeholders who may have had mixed experiences with BI in the past.
  • Tools: Proficiency in data visualization tools like Tableau is essential, as you'll be building dashboards autonomously.

🤝 About Your Future Manager

You will work closely with Omar , our Lead Data Analysts.

His background:

With his Data Science Engineering degree Omar was the first Data Analytics lead at Qonto and grew the team from 4 to 25 talented individuals. He partnered with the Product, Growth, Strategy, Finance, and People departments over the past 3 years. Before joining Qonto, Omar always worked in the Data field in different data-heavy industries such as the airline industry focusing on Revenue Management and the ad tech industry specifically on Sales Performance optimization.

What can he bring to you and the team?

Omar can offer strategic data leadership and analytics expertise to elevate the team's capabilities, infusing a robust data-informed culture that drives innovative product development and sharpens our competitive edge in the marketplace. Their collaborative approach and dedication to mentorship will not only enhance your technical proficiency but also foster a shared vision for success across the entire organization.

🏅About You

  • Experience: You have a strong background in growth analytics, particularly in areas like onboarding or website analytics. Experience in fintech or B2B is preferred.
  • Mastery: You excel at root cause analysis, impact measurement, and providing actionable recommendations based on data insights.
  • You have a strong Business Sense, you can challenge and define the business Value of a project and have the ability to leverage it to inform analysis and recommendations.
  • Strong relationship-building skills with partners and stakeholders
  • You’ve got a strong experience in building interactive dashboards and selecting the right type of visualization to convey the message behind the data. You understand user interface and user experience principles to create dashboards that are easy to use, accessible to various stakeholders, and most importantly, actionable
  • You’re not afraid of learning new tools if they serve your goal. You probably already know Python, SQL, and Tableau (or a similar dashboarding tool) and look forward to adding new skills to your belt.
  • A statistical background is a plus: you differentiate an anomaly in data from statistical noise.
  • Other traits and skills we are looking for include accountability, energy, a hands-on mindset (when needed), and framing problems/situations sharply.

At Qonto we understand that true diversity isn't just about ticking boxes on a hiring checklist. Apply regardless of the boxes you tick! Who knows? You may have the missing piece of the puzzle we've been searching for all along.

🎁 Perks

A tailor-made and dynamic career track. An inclusive work environment. And so much more to help you succeed.

  • Offices in Paris, Berlin, Milan, Barcelona, and Belgrade;
  • Tailor-made remote work policy depending on the job you apply for and where you live;
  • Competitive salary package;
  • A meal voucher;
  • Public transportation reimbursement (part or global);
  • A great health insurance (depending on the country);
  • Employee well-being initiatives: access to Moka Care to take care of your mental health and great offers for sports and wellness activities;
  • A progressive disability and parenthood policy (1 in 6 of Qonto employees is a parent!) and childcare benefits with selected partners;
  • Monthly team events.

💪 Our hiring process:

  • Interviews with your Talent Acquisition Manager and future managers
  • A remote exercise to demonstrate your skills and give you a taste of what working at Qonto could be like

We will send you an interview guide so you can best prepare yourself.

On average, our process lasts 20 working days and offers usually follow within 48 hours 🤞

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Job Description

Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)

THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.

THE ROLE As a Senior Data Analyst at Oetker Digital, you will play a critical role in owning and leveraging data to drive business decisions and strategies. You will work closely with various teams and business partners on the side of our Group companies to ask the right questions, deeply understand the business domains and processes, analyze datasets, generate insights and business cases based on data that help our brands grow and succeed in the digital space. Your expertise will guide the optimization of brand, marketing and sales strategies, product development, and customer engagement initiatives.

What You'll Do


Partner and collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their strategies, needs and objectives
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key business partners to ensure data solutions align with business goals
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Analyze datasets to extract actionable insights and support data-driven decision making
Develop and implement statistical models to solve complex business problems
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making
Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable insights through effective data storytelling


Requirements

WHAT YOU'LL BRING


At least 5 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficiency in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
Experience in Marketing Analytics & Optimization
You like to learn, work hands-on, take ownership, and have an impact
Fluent in German and English


What We Offer


Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year’s Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child’s sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to €1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners
Show more

Title: Data Analyst*in
Description:
Data Analyst*in (m/w/d)

DKB AG

Standort: Berlin

unbefristet

Teil- & Vollzeit möglich

ab sofort

Deine Aufgaben


Du arbeitest im Bereich Business Intelligence in einem interdisziplinären Team von Expert*innen und versorgst dort als Data Analyst*in die Facheinheiten der Banksteuerung mit relevanten Daten und Insights
Du bist Sparringspartner*in für den*die Product Owner*in und führst Workshops zur Auftragsklärung und Anforderungsspezifikation durch
Du analysierst DKB-interne und externe Datenquellen und definierst fachliche Regeln und Rahmenbedingungen für eine Datenintegration
Du schlägst die Brücke zwischen Anforderungen aus dem Business und der technischen Implementierung, begleitest die Umsetzung und testest neue Artefakte auf Herz und Niere
Du kooperierst eng mit unseren Data Engineers und mit Expert*innen zu den Themen Datenarchitektur, Datenmodellierung, Data Governance, Datenqualität und Datenschutz
Du führst Datenanalysen durch und unterstützt deine Stakeholder bei der Entscheidungsfindung
Du nutzt einen modernen Toolstack und arbeitest in einem agilen Setup
Du bringst dich aktiv in unsere Data Analyst Community ein, teilst dein Wissen und bleibst immer up to date


Dein Profil


Du hast deinen Bachelor oder Master in (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, (Wirtschafts-)Mathematik oder einem vergleichbaren quantitativen Studiengang in der Tasche und bringst bereits relevante Berufserfahrung als Data Analyst*in mit
Mit deinen Erfahrungen im Anforderungsmanagement kannst du komplexe Aufgaben verstehen, priorisieren und sie im Team lösen
Du weißt, wie eine Bank funktioniert und gesteuert wird und es interessiert dich, wie ihre Bereiche mit den für sie relevanten Daten versorgt werden
Kenntnisse in SQL, Python, BI Tools und Datenvisualisierung bringst du mit
Analytisch-ganzheitliche Denkweise und Stakeholdermanagement gehören zu deinen Stärken
Data Vault und 3NF sowie Jira und Confluence sind keine Fremdwörter für dich


Die DKB steht für Vielfalt und Chancengerechtigkeit. Egal, woher du kommst, wie alt du bist, welches Geschlecht, welche Genderidentität, sexuelle Orientierung oder Religion du hast, ob mit oder ohne Behinderung - wir freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung!

Deine Benefits und mehr


Attraktive Vergütung (tariflich oder außertariflich)
Flexibles und mobiles Arbeiten – temporär auch im EU-Ausland
Du hast die Wahl: Benefits Pass, Jobticket oder Jobrad
Moderne Technik- ausstattung und Tool Stack.
Individuelle Qualifi- zierungsmöglichkeiten
Duz-Kultur und kein Dresscode
Externe Mitarbeitenden- beratung
Angebote zum Gesundbleiben
Weitere Extras wie z.B. betriebliche Altersvorsorge und Versicherungsschutz


Immer für dich ansprechbar

Kristina Fink

Expertise Lead

recruiting@dkb.de

Deutsche Kreditbank AG

Du möchtest mehr zur DKB erfahren?

Dann schau auf unserer Karriereseite vorbei.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
Your role

We are seeking a curious and versatile Data Analyst who has strong SQL skills and has worked with Tableau to join our team of seven data professionals. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional analytical and problem solving skills, as well as solid communication skills enabling them to share analytical insights effectively with business stakeholders from marketing, operations and the executive layer. The person in this role will serve as a trusted advisor to the stakeholders and contribute to the overall health and quality of the data platform.


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data analysis tasks
Design and participate in the modelling of KPIs
Advise on and come up with performance indicators and proxies for visualisation of the success of different teams
Work with stakeholders to support them navigate the Data environment, understand and work with the reports relevant to them
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business outcomes
Create, verify and maintain visualisations to effectively communicate insights
Suggest actions, based on the data insights and work with teams to develop their strategies


Your profile


Bachelor’s and Master’s degrees in Social Science or Statistics, with a solid track record as a Data Analyst and a strong emphasis on data manipulation
Proficiency in SQL, hands-on experience with Google Analytics, GTM, Google Ads, and event data, as well as knowledge of data warehousing (BigQuery) and architecture, is desirable!
Hands-on experience with Tableau; experience with dbt, GetKlar, and TimeSquare is a significant plus!
Understanding of classic e-commerce KPIs and metrics, with the ability to contextualize each data point in relation to others
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and extract actionable insights
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with familiarity in multi-cultural environments


What we offer


An appealing discount on all of our products – from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients
We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year
The Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticket
A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a flexible work model and 'workation'
Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia
You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas
Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world
We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day


Apply with your CV and cover letter via our application portal. To show us that you've read the entire job ad, please include the phrase 'YES, I AM SUNDAY'S NEW TEAM MEMBER' in the first sentence of your cover letter.

Contact

Sabrina Thome

Apply for this job

About Us

Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy – as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations.

We take our ecological responsibility very seriously: Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable.

We have a diverse team of 190 people and 37 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues.

We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you don’t match with 100% of the requirements.

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Shipping Pricing
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

At Vinted, Shipping Pricing is a key channel to grow our platform by making high-stake investment decisions. We have a Decision Scientist opening in the Shipping Pricing area. As a Decision Scientist, you’ll join our Marketing Data Science & Analytics (Marketing DSA) team where a mix of talented people with backgrounds from academia, econometrics, e-commerce, consulting, and media apply a scientific approach to solve worldwide business problems. You will report to the Manager of Data Science & Analytics and work in the team of experienced Decision and Data Scientists.

In the Shipping Pricing domain, in addition to being a member of Marketing DSA, you’ll also become a member of the Shipping Pricing team – a key team driving Vinted Marketplace growth through shipping discount strategies. Your primary responsibility will be to enable the team to optimise our investments via experimentation (AB testing), in-depth data analysis, and creation of new ROI models. In this role, you will collaborate with analytics engineers, decision scientists, and pricing analysts to identify and fulfil data requirements in this area.

Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision-making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.


In this position, you’ll


Create High Impact: Contribute to the development of new ROI/ROAS and payback models to measure Shipping Discount campaigns’ performance
Always remain challenged: Investigate revenue streams that Shipping Pricing generates – think of acquisition, reactivation and engagement on both sides of a two-sided market, i.e. seller and buyer
Be involved: Analyse how shipping discount investments drive user acquisition and retention, engagement, and lifetime value
Raise Our Data Quality Standards: Drive the usage of data & analytics within the organisation by making the Shipping Pricing data obvious for everyone to understand, interpret, and use in daily decision-making
Co-create across Marketplace & DSA: Pitch your findings to your team as well as marketing or shipping pricing colleagues to pivot the models used to measure success


About You


Strong statistical, analytical, strategic, and business skills
Highly business-results-oriented and able to connect science with pragmatic problem-solving
A good communicator who can present results in an informative and persuasive manner to a wide range of stakeholders
Intermediate-to-extensive working experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, or Data Scientist
Experienced with AB testing and measuring causal relationships using advanced statistical methods
Strong knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Stata, Matlab etc.)
Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)
A graduate degree in statistics, econometrics, economics, business or a similar field
Excellent at communicating in written and spoken English
Advantage: Previous experience with Marketing Analytics, in particular, ROI/ROAS models
Advantage: Strong econometrics knowledge (statistical models, regression analyses)
Advantage: Advanced knowledge of R/Python


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 57,000 - € 85,300 gross per year.
Show more
HTML:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

At Vinted, Shipping Pricing is a key channel to grow our platform by making high-stake investment decisions. We have a Decision Scientist opening in the Shipping Pricing area. As a Decision Scientist, you’ll join our Marketing Data Science & Analytics (Marketing DSA) team where a mix of talented people with backgrounds from academia, econometrics, e-commerce, consulting, and media apply a scientific approach to solve worldwide business problems. You will report to the Manager of Data Science & Analytics and work in the team of experienced Decision and Data Scientists.

In the Shipping Pricing domain, in addition to being a member of Marketing DSA, you’ll also become a member of the Shipping Pricing team – a key team driving Vinted Marketplace growth through shipping discount strategies. Your primary responsibility will be to enable the team to optimise our investments via experimentation (AB testing), in-depth data analysis, and creation of new ROI models. In this role, you will collaborate with analytics engineers, decision scientists, and pricing analysts to identify and fulfil data requirements in this area.

Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:

  • Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision-making.
  • Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
  • Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.

In this position, you’ll

  • Create High Impact: Contribute to the development of new ROI/ROAS and payback models to measure Shipping Discount campaigns’ performance
  • Always remain challenged: Investigate revenue streams that Shipping Pricing generates – think of acquisition, reactivation and engagement on both sides of a two-sided market, i.e. seller and buyer
  • Be involved: Analyse how shipping discount investments drive user acquisition and retention, engagement, and lifetime value
  • Raise Our Data Quality Standards: Drive the usage of data & analytics within the organisation by making the Shipping Pricing data obvious for everyone to understand, interpret, and use in daily decision-making
  • Co-create across Marketplace & DSA: Pitch your findings to your team as well as marketing or shipping pricing colleagues to pivot the models used to measure success

About You

  • Strong statistical, analytical, strategic, and business skills
  • Highly business-results-oriented and able to connect science with pragmatic problem-solving
  • A good communicator who can present results in an informative and persuasive manner to a wide range of stakeholders
  • Intermediate-to-extensive working experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, or Data Scientist
  • Experienced with AB testing and measuring causal relationships using advanced statistical methods
  • Strong knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Stata, Matlab etc.)
  • Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)
  • A graduate degree in statistics, econometrics, economics, business or a similar field
  • Excellent at communicating in written and spoken English
  • Advantage: Previous experience with Marketing Analytics, in particular, ROI/ROAS models
  • Advantage: Strong econometrics knowledge (statistical models, regression analyses)
  • Advantage: Advanced knowledge of R/Python

Work perks

  • The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
  • 30 days of paid annual leave
  • Newest MacBook models
  • Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
  • Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
  • A daily lunch allowance
  • Frequent team-building events
  • A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
  • Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
  • Subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
  • A subsidised Deutschlandticket
  • The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
  • A dog-friendly office

Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

Equal Opportunity

We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

Title: Junior BI Analyst - Startup (m/w/d)
Description:
Wir sind ein dynamisches Beratungsteam, das es sich zum Ziel gemacht hat, schlanke, digitale und nachhaltige Finanz- und Admin-Lösungen für Startups zu entwickeln und umzusetzen. Wir verstehen uns als externes Finance Office und bilden dabei das gesamte Finance-Themenspektrum, von Buchhaltung bis BI-Reporting ab.

Aufgaben


Du unterstützt das Team rund um das Thema Business Intelligence & Data Analytics
Du entwickelst eigenständig Reporting Dashboards und Kennzahlen in Power BI
Du begleitest du die Analyse, Aufnahme und Dokumentation von Planungs- und Reportingprozessen in vielfältigen Unternehmensfunktionen (z.B. Finanzen, Controlling).
Du wirst aktiv in unsere Kundenprojekte eingebunden und übernimmst vielfältige Aufgaben


Qualifikation


Du hast Betriebswirtschaft, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Wirtschaftsinformatik oder etwas vergleichbares, idealerweise mit einer Spezialisierung auf Finanzen studiert (der Abschluss ist nicht erforderlich)
Du verfügst über erste Berufserfahrungen im Bereich Business Intelligence und hast bereits erste Erfahrungen mit Power BI oder anderen BI Lösungen gemacht
Du kannst analytisch denken, hast eine Affinität zu Zahlen und eine Hands-on Mentalität
Du interessierst dich für neue Geschäftsmodelle und den Aufbau von finanziellen Grundstrukturen und -prozessen (Financial Planning)
Du kannst selbstständig arbeiten und hast keine Angst davor, die Initiative zu ergreifen
Du besitzt verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse (C2) und idealerweise gute Englischkenntnisse (C1)
Du bist motiviert, diszipliniert und lösungsorientiert


Benefits


Eine steile Lernkurve durch die direkte Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Gründern
Wir sind ein kleines agiles Team, das Wert auf Austausch, Offenheit und das Einbringen von Ideen setzt
Einblick in eine Vielfalt von Unternehmen und Geschäftsmodellen durch die verschiedenen Kundenprojekte
Einen modern ausgestatteter Arbeitsplatz mitten in Kreuzberg umgeben von Startups und einem kulinarischen Hotspot
Die Möglichkeit flexibel in Office und Home-Office zu arbeiten
Eine freundliche, interessante und kooperative Arbeitsatmosphäre
Regelmäßige Teamevents und regelmäßige Feedback Gespräche
Show more

  • Einblick in eine Vielfalt von Unternehmen und Geschäftsmodellen durch die verschiedenen Kundenprojekte
  • Einen modern ausgestatteter Arbeitsplatz mitten in Kreuzberg umgeben von Startups und einem kulinarischen Hotspot

  • Regelmäßige Teamevents und regelmäßige Feedback Gespräche

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Das erwartet dich bei uns

Als Data Analyst (w/m/d) bei Kess wirst du uns dabei unterstützen, durch datengetriebene Entscheidungsfindung Wettbewerbsvorteile zu erzielen und langfristig erfolgreich zu sein. Du verantwortest die systematische Erhebung, Aufbereitung und Auswertung von Website-, Produkt- und Konsumentendaten. Hierfür beziehst du Daten aus unterschiedlichsten Quellen ein und kümmerst dich um deren Aufbereitung in Form von Reportings und Dashboards. Deine Erkenntnisse präsentierst du unserem Managementteam und den Kanalverantwortlichen und leitest Handlungsempfehlungen ab.

Zusätzlich Kümmerst Du Dich Um Die


Beschaffung, Bereinigung und Analyse von Daten zur Identifizierung von Trends, Mustern und Korrelationen zur Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen
Erstellung und Visualisierung von Berichten und Dashboards für verschiedene Geschäftsbereiche, wie beispielsweise Marketing und Operations
Automatisierung von Prozessen und Reportingstrukturen zur Effizienzsteigerung und Qualitätssicherung der Datenanalyse
Kontinuierliche Sicherstellung und Monitoring der Datenqualität
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Stakeholdern, insbesondere dem CEO und unserem Managementteam, um Geschäftsentscheidungen zu unterstützen



Unsere Wünsche an dich


Ein abgeschlossenes Studium mit analytischem Schwerpunkt (z.B. BWL, Statistik, Informatik, Mathematik, etc.) oder vergleichbare Qualifikationen
Mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics, idealerweise im E-Commerce und/oder Marketing
Hervorragende Kenntnisse in Excel, sicherer Umgang mit SQL und weitere Programmiersprachen sind von Vorteil
Erfahrung im Umgang mit großen Datenmengen (Data Warehouse, idealerweise BigQuery) sowie mit Visualisierungstools (z.B. Looker Studio, PowerBI, Tableau)
Starke analytische Skills und die Fähigkeit aussagekräftige Berichte und Dashboards zu gestalten
Sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und Spaß daran vor vielen Leuten deine Erkenntnisse zu präsentieren
Strukturiertes und eigeninitiatives Arbeiten gehört für dich dazu, du bist aber auch ein Teamplayer und versuchst gemeinsam mit dem Team Kess noch erfolgreicher zu machen
Fließende Englisch- und sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse



Das bieten wir dir


Rabatt auf unsere Produkte
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und hybrides Arbeitsmodell
30 Tage Urlaub und die Möglichkeit 25 Tage Remote (innerhalb EU) zu arbeiten pro Jahr
Corporate Benefits Plattform und die Möglichkeit auf ein Leasing-Bike
Freie Wahl des technischen Equipments (Windows / Mac) und ein modernes, hundefreundliches Büro mit idealer Verkehrsanbindung
Monatliche After-Work-Drinks und regelmäßige Teamevents
Ein dynamisches und offenes Arbeitsumfeld, mit transparenter Unternehmens- und Feedback-Kultur
Die Chance, Teil eines schnell wachsenden Unternehmens mit motivierten, internationalen Arbeitskollegen zu sein, in dem man Ideen einbringen und mitwirken kann
Show more

  • Monatliche After-Work-Drinks und regelmäßige Teamevents
  • Ein dynamisches und offenes Arbeitsumfeld, mit transparenter Unternehmens- und Feedback-Kultur
  • Die Chance, Teil eines schnell wachsenden Unternehmens mit motivierten, internationalen Arbeitskollegen zu sein, in dem man Ideen einbringen und mitwirken kann

Title: Social Media Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Daten über das Social Media Verhalten deiner Zielgruppe faszinieren dich? Du liebst es, aus einer großen, ungeordneten Menge an Zahlen, konkrete Schlüsse zu ziehen und dein gewonnenes Wissen für andere verständlich zu machen? Du bist außerdem detailverliebt und hast Lust neue Prozesse mitzugestalten?

Dann sucht unser Team Dich! Als Social Media Analyst (w/m/d).

Bewirb Dich! Auch wenn das Profil auf den ersten Blick nicht zu 100% passt.

Aufgaben


Auswertung und Analyse von Performance-Daten auf allen relevanten Social-Media-Kanälen
Nutzung von Analyse-Tools (Sprinklr, Google Analytics, Google Looker Studio etc.)
Ableiten und Präsentieren von relevanten Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen
Optimierung/Automatisierung von Datenverarbeitung und Prozessen
Visuelle Datenaufbereitung & Dashboarding
Unterstützung von interdisziplinären Projektteams
Die Chance, mit einer der weltweit führenden Automobilmarken zu arbeiten


Qualifikation


Expertise im Bereich Social Media Analytics, zusätzliche Kenntnisse in Social-Media-Strategie und Advertising
Ein Gespür für Zahlen
Kompetenz im Umgang mit den aktuell relevanten Social-Media-Netzwerken
Fähigkeit zum Aufbau vertrauensvoller Kund:innenbeziehungen
Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office und eine unbändige Excel-Leidenschaft
Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Interesse an der Automobilbranche ist von Vorteil


Benefits


Hybrides Arbeitszeitmodell mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Regelmäßige Teamevents
Bis zu vier Wochen im Jahr im EU-Ausland arbeiten
30 Urlaubstage für alle Mitarbeiter:innen
Unbefristeter Vertrag nach 6-monatiger Probezeit
Raum zur Entfaltung und zum eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten in deiner neuen Rolle
Jährliches Weiterbildungsbudget mit individuellem Gestaltungsspielraum


Wer wir sind

Seit 2008 Kreativagentur und Unternehmensberatung mit über 200 sehr guten Leuten in Berlin-Kreuzberg.


Autonomie, Vertrauen und Gestaltungsspielraum sind unsere Vision der modernen Arbeitswelt von morgen.
Wir unterstützen uns gegenseitig und glauben an die kulturstiftende Wirkung von regelmäßigen Teamevents zur beruflichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung.
Diversity, Gleichberechtigung sowie eine gesunde Work-Life Balance gehören zu unseren wichtigsten Werten.
Unser transparenter Feedbackprozess trägt bei uns zu einer offenen und wertschätzenden Kommunikationskultur bei.
Wir wollen zu deinem Leben passen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Work-Life-Care-Service des Fürstenberg Instituts an.


Wir freuen uns über deine digitale Bewerbung unter Angabe deines optimalen Einstiegstermins.
Show more

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Aufgabenspektrum

Mitarbeit im Aufbau, der Implementierung und Betreuung von prozessualer und kommerziell getriebener Analytik.
Unterstützung in der Konzeption, Implementierung und Weiterentwicklung von Reports mittels Microsoft Power BI und deren zugrundeliegende Datenaufbereitung.
Unterstützung in der Abstimmungen von reportingbezogenen Anforderungen und Ergebnissen mit unseren internen Auftraggebern und sowie in der Interpretation und Bewertung von Analysen.




Anforderungsprofil

Erfahrung im Business Intelligence Umfeld, idealerweise mit Controlling Hintergrund.
Energiewirtschaftliche Kenntnisse wären vorteilhaft aber nicht zwingend erforderlich.
Fundierte Kenntnisse im Rahmen der BI spezifischen Datenverarbeitung mit SQL sowie der Datenvisualisierung mittels Microsoft Power BI.
Idealerweise Erfahrung in der Nutzung von Databricks und dem Einsatz von Python im BI-Kontext.
Deutsch auf Muttersprachen-Niveau.
Show more
HTML:
Aufgabenspektrum

  • Mitarbeit im Aufbau, der Implementierung und Betreuung von prozessualer und kommerziell getriebener Analytik.
  • Unterstützung in der Konzeption, Implementierung und Weiterentwicklung von Reports mittels Microsoft Power BI und deren zugrundeliegende Datenaufbereitung.
  • Unterstützung in der Abstimmungen von reportingbezogenen Anforderungen und Ergebnissen mit unseren internen Auftraggebern und sowie in der Interpretation und Bewertung von Analysen.


Anforderungsprofil

  • Erfahrung im Business Intelligence Umfeld, idealerweise mit Controlling Hintergrund.
  • Energiewirtschaftliche Kenntnisse wären vorteilhaft aber nicht zwingend erforderlich.
  • Fundierte Kenntnisse im Rahmen der BI spezifischen Datenverarbeitung mit SQL sowie der Datenvisualisierung mittels Microsoft Power BI.
  • Idealerweise Erfahrung in der Nutzung von Databricks und dem Einsatz von Python im BI-Kontext.
  • Deutsch auf Muttersprachen-Niveau.

Title: Senior People Data & Reporting Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Senior HR Data & Reporting Analyst (all genders) to join the People Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

About the People Analytics team:


Data Infrastructure & Architecture: We design and maintain the data warehouse (AWS or BigQuery), integrating new systems to enhance our analytic capabilities while ensuring data privacy compliance.
Reporting and Visualization: Define and standardize People KPIs across local teams, and deliver automated reporting solutions via Tableau or other BI tools for effective data visualization.
Advanced Analytics & Data Science: Discover and communicate meaningful patterns in people data, using analytics and data science models to provide actionable insights.
Purpose and Mission: Enable senior leaders to make data-driven decisions, enhance employee experience, and improve business performance through comprehensive data analysis.
Long-term Goals: Aim for global reporting of key metrics with high accuracy, simplify complex HR and business challenges, and integrate data insights into daily decision-making.
Collaborative Approach: Work closely with local People Analytics teams to align metrics and reporting standards, ensuring a unified approach to data management.
Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with People Analytics teams, CHROs, P&C leaders, People Partners, and Senior Leaders for strategic decision-making based on reliable data.
Value Addition: Harmonize data across global teams, creating a single source of truth for reliable and consistent leadership decisions.


About the role:


Data Warehouse Management: Design, build, and maintain the architecture and infrastructure of our data warehouse, ensuring system integration and data compliance.
KPI Standardization: Define and align People KPIs across local teams, and implement automated reporting solutions for streamlined data visualization and analysis.
Analytics and Insights: Use advanced analytics to uncover meaningful patterns in people data, and develop data science models that provide actionable insights.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Gather requirements from CHROs and other stakeholders, translate these into actionable plans, and serve as the primary contact for people data.
Global Reporting: Collaborate with local teams for global reporting of key metrics, ensuring a unified and reliable data source for strategic decisions.
Training and Adoption: Provide training and support to drive the adoption of new BI tools and reporting practices, enhancing overall data literacy and user experience.


What you need to be successful


Background working in similar People/HR data-driven role (3+ years of experience, a must)
Advanced SQL and knowledge about data pipelines
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science or other technical fields
Proven, direct experience with Tableau and demonstrate storytelling capabilities
Data visualization artist, able to create new and engaging ways of visualizing People data


Nice to have:


Worked in cross functional teams and can manage senior stakeholders
Fundamental understanding of statistics and basic principles of data analysis


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Online Canteen, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Social Media Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Daten über das Social Media Verhalten deiner Zielgruppe faszinieren dich? Du liebst es, aus einer großen, ungeordneten Menge an Zahlen, konkrete Schlüsse zu ziehen und dein gewonnenes Wissen für andere verständlich zu machen? Du bist außerdem detailverliebt und hast Lust neue Prozesse mitzugestalten?

Dann sucht unser Team Dich! Als Social Media Analyst (w/m/d).

Bewirb Dich! Auch wenn das Profil auf den ersten Blick nicht zu 100% passt.




Was erwartet dich

Auswertung und Analyse von Performance-Daten auf allen relevanten Social-Media-Kanälen
Nutzung von Analyse-Tools (Sprinklr, Google Analytics, Google Looker Studio etc.)
Ableiten und Präsentieren von relevanten Erkenntnissen und Empfehlungen
Optimierung/Automatisierung von Datenverarbeitung und Prozessen
Visuelle Datenaufbereitung & Dashboarding
Unterstützung von interdisziplinären Projektteams
Die Chance, mit einer der weltweit führenden Automobilmarken zu arbeiten




Was bringst du mit

Expertise im Bereich Social Media Analytics, zusätzliche Kenntnisse in Social-Media-Strategie und Advertising
Ein Gespür für Zahlen
Kompetenz im Umgang mit den aktuell relevanten Social-Media-Netzwerken
Fähigkeit zum Aufbau vertrauensvoller Kund:innenbeziehungen
Sicherer Umgang mit MS Office und eine unbändige Excel-Leidenschaft
Ausgezeichnete Deutsch- und gute Englischkenntnisse
Interesse an der Automobilbranche ist von Vorteil




Wer wir sind

Seit 2008 Kreativagentur und Unternehmensberatung mit über 200 sehr guten Leuten an unserem Standort in Berlin-Kreuzberg.

Autonomie, Vertrauen und Gestaltungsspielraum sind unsere Vision der modernen Arbeitswelt von morgen.
Wir unterstützen uns gegenseitig und glauben an die kulturstiftende Wirkung von regelmäßigen Teamevents zur beruflichen und persönlichen Weiterentwicklung.
Diversity, Gleichberechtigung sowie eine gesunde Work-Life Balance gehören zu unseren wichtigsten Werten.
Unser transparenter Feedbackprozess trägt bei uns zu einer offenen und wertschätzenden Kommunikationskultur bei.
Wir wollen zu deinem Leben passen. Zur Unterstützung in jeder Lebensphase bieten wir den vollen Work-Life-Care-Service des Fürstenberg Instituts an.




Was wir bieten

Hybrides Arbeitszeitmodell mit flexiblen Arbeitszeiten
Regelmäßige Teamevents
Bis zu vier Wochen im Jahr im EU-Ausland arbeiten
30 Urlaubstage für alle Mitarbeiter:innen
Unbefristeter Vertrag nach 6-monatiger Probezeit
Raum zur Entfaltung und zum eigenverantwortlichen Arbeiten in deiner neuen Rolle
Jährliches Weiterbildungsbudget mit individuellem Gestaltungsspielraum




Wir freuen uns über deine digitale Bewerbung unter Angabe deines optimalen Einstiegstermins an talent@tlgg.de.

Show more
