Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The role is for someone who is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable to work on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

Responsibilities


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie’s portfolio
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


You have 5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in data and analytics concepts, tools, and methodologies
Have prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
Hybrid working approach enabling a good balance working from home and the office
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program, that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG)
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 46 nationalities
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.
Show more

Title: Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music publisher worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.

BMG’s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We’re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.

We are currently seeking an experienced Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. As a seasoned Data Analyst, you will guide junior analysts and collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!

 

What You’ll Be Doing


Process big data volumes, modeling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (e.g. Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs
Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Finance)
Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products
Interact with developers, data engineers, and management to propose new technologies, processes and system improvements, as well as global data governance strategies
Provide training and mentorship to junior team members, empowering them to excel in their contributions to the team’s projects
Develop sustainable processes and methodologies to support the effectiveness of our Data Analytics function


What You Bring


Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or related field
Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
Strong interest to mentor junior colleagues with enthusiasm and expertise
Capability to plan and implement projects independently
Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment


It’s also a plus if you have…


Team leadership experience
Prior music industry experience
Experience with GCP, dbt and Git
Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
Understanding of statistical methods and ML
Experience using ETL frameworks


What We Offer


A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work.
Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
Long-term career opportunities for all employees.
A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters.
Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team.


This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

All applicants to BMG are treated equally - regardless of age, disability, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy or parenthood, ethnic origin, color, nationality, religion or belief.

(BMG is publishing Kurt Cobain's catalog, including the 1992 single 'Come As You Are.')

HTML:
Founded in 2008, BMG has become the fourth-largest music publisher worldwide. Our success and competitive edge are rooted in our founding values of fairness, transparency, and service. Our mission is clear: to empower artists and songwriters to maximize the potential of their songs and recordings in the digital era.

BMG’s Global Data Analytics is our central data unit, spanning a close-knit international team of experienced Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts and Data Scientists across Germany, the US and the UK. We’re transforming how music works, enabling operational stakeholders to make data-driven decisions as well as driving strategic growth, based on a modern data stack.

We are currently seeking an experienced Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d) to join our headquarters in Berlin. As a seasoned Data Analyst, you will guide junior analysts and collaborate with senior stakeholders of various departments to facilitate informed decision-making through novel data insights, compelling storytelling, and advanced data visualization. Join us in shaping the future of music analytics!

 

What You’ll Be Doing

  • Process big data volumes, modeling and transforming data (using dbt) from centralized DWHs (e.g. Google BigQuery) and external/organizational databases to build strategic analyses and operational KPIs
  • Utilize data visualization to support decision-making, crafting compelling (Looker) dashboards for key business stakeholders (e.g. Investments, Artist & Repertoire, Marketing, Streaming Sales, Rights & Royalties, Finance)
  • Develop scalable self-service reporting solutions and address diverse ad-hoc requests that transform our business
  • Collaborate closely with our global team and international colleagues to foster a data-driven culture by proposing innovative initiatives and building actionable data products
  • Interact with developers, data engineers, and management to propose new technologies, processes and system improvements, as well as global data governance strategies
  • Provide training and mentorship to junior team members, empowering them to excel in their contributions to the team’s projects
  • Develop sustainable processes and methodologies to support the effectiveness of our Data Analytics function

What You Bring

  • Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Economics, Mathematics, or related field
  • Profound experience in data analytics, ideally with large datasets
  • Excellent SQL skills and good knowledge of Python
  • Proficiency in data visualization tools, such as Looker or Tableau
  • Broad understanding of data analysis methods and storytelling
  • Results-driven and analytical character, with a strategic mindset to derive business insights
  • Effective communication skills - confident in presenting findings to senior management
  • Ability to build relationships with stakeholders to understand business needs and data consumer needs
  • Strong interest to mentor junior colleagues with enthusiasm and expertise
  • Capability to plan and implement projects independently
  • Comfortable working in a global, fast-paced and dynamic environment

It’s also a plus if you have…

  • Team leadership experience
  • Prior music industry experience
  • Experience with GCP, dbt and Git
  • Knowledge of Jira and Confluence
  • Understanding of statistical methods and ML
  • Experience using ETL frameworks

What We Offer

  • A modern office in the heart of Berlin and flexible options for remote work.
  • Numerous benefits such as a free BVG job ticket, a reduced-price membership for Urban Sports, company bike leasing, discounts for Bertelsmann employees, among others
  • Ongoing training opportunities on our internal platforms BMG Campus and Bertelsmann University
  • Long-term career opportunities for all employees.
  • A collaborative work environment with an open, appreciative community of people who all share the same passion for working with artists and songwriters.
  • Our unique corporate culture based on strong values and mutual support that make us a great team.

This is us

As the great Kurt Cobain once said, "Come as you are." BMG is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees. We value diversity in all forms. Equal opportunity is deeply rooted in our core value of fairness, and we are committed to creating a truly inclusive work environment where everyone can thrive. If you're good at what you do, come as you are! Whether you're an experienced professional or just starting out, we welcome you to join our team.

Title: Geographic Information Systems Analyst
Description:
Get to know Elawan




Embark on a transformative journey with Elawan Energy, a global operator in the renewable energy industry. We specialize in providing integrated solutions across the entire lifecycle of clean energy, from the promotion, development, and construction of wind farms, photovoltaic plants, and hydroelectric power stations, to their operation, maintenance, and the sale of the generated clean energy. Currently, Elawan boasts an impressive portfolio of 8 GW in projects, with 2.5 GW in Operation and another 5.5 GW in an earlier Development stage. This underscores our unwavering commitment to the expansion and investment in renewable energies. Join us in shaping a sustainable future as we continue to lead the way in the global renewable energy landscape."




We are seeking a skilled GIS Analyst to join our team in Germany and support our renewable energy projects through geospatial analysis. The GIS Analyst will play a crucial role in identifying and analyzing potential project sites in the Country, evaluating environmental impacts, and managing spatial data for wind, solar, and hydropower projects. This individual will collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to ensure the accurate integration of geospatial data in the planning, development, and management of renewable energy projects.

Key Responsibilities:

Geospatial Analysis: Conduct geospatial analyses to identify optimal sites for renewable energy projects, including wind, solar, and hydropower.
Data Management: Manage, organize, and maintain geospatial datasets related to environmental, topographical, and infrastructural information.
Site Suitability Assessments: Perform suitability analyses for project siting, considering factors such as land use, environmental regulations, wind/solar potential, and proximity to grid infrastructure.
Mapping & Visualization: Produce high-quality maps, visualizations, and reports to support project development, regulatory approvals, and stakeholder communications.
Spatial Data Integration: Work closely with engineering, environmental, and project development teams to integrate GIS data into technical models, impact assessments, and project plans.
Environmental Impact Analysis: Use geospatial tools to assess potential environmental impacts and regulatory constraints related to new project sites.
Field Data Collection: Support the planning and implementation of field surveys and data collection efforts, ensuring data is accurately captured and integrated into GIS systems.
Database Management: Develop and maintain GIS databases, ensuring data quality, accuracy, and accessibility for internal teams.
Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with regulatory agencies, landowners, and community stakeholders to provide geospatial insights and address concerns regarding project development.

Required Skills and Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Geography, Geospatial Sciences, Environmental Science, or a related field.
2-4 years of experience as a GIS Analyst, preferably within the renewable energy, environmental, or infrastructure sectors.
Proficiency with GIS software (e.g., ArcGIS, QGIS) and related tools.
Experience with remote sensing, spatial analysis, and geospatial data visualization.
Strong understanding of environmental regulations in Germany, land-use planning German scheme, and renewable energy project development.
Familiarity with data formats such as shapefiles, geodatabases, and CAD data.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present technical information to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python) and spatial databases (e.g., PostgreSQL/PostGIS) is a plus.




By selecting "Apply" above, you indicate that you have read and agree to Elawan Energy's Privacy Notice: https://www.elawan.com/gestion-de-la-privacidad/en




About us:




👉⚡️🌱🚀Why choose Elawan?




A good work environment.
Belonging to an expert team in a pioneering sector that is growing globally.
Be part of a leading company with a consolidated competitive position.
Dynamic and agile work mindset.
International and interdisciplinary environment.
Competitive salary.
Flexible compensation plan.
Flexible working hours.
Possibility to get involved in transversal projects of the organisation.




Among Elawan Energy's values we would like to underline tenacity and trust as a strong element in our values and practices. Reinforcing these principles has a real impact on the engagement satisfaction, increases the talent and leadership quality of our professionals. To achieve our objectives, we aim to attract, develop and retain diversified profiles, embracing equality as a key factor and a fundamental differentiator of innovation in our organisation. We welcome and value all individuals, and we are committed to the sense of belonging of each person who joins our company.




To get to know more about Elawan and its projects please visit our website - www.elawan.com/




*** WE ARE NOT USING THIRD PARTIES IN ORDER TO COVER THIS POSITION ***

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are seeking an organised and self-motivated Data Analyst to work embedded in our Marketing Data team, one of our cross-functional Data teams to help shape the development of one of the world's leading FinTech products.

As a Senior Data Analyst you will enable our Marketing team to make data-driven decisions. You will monitor, measure and analyse the effectiveness of your marketing teams’ initiatives, as well as help drive the strategy of your stakeholder teams. You are here to establish a data-mindset and thereby to foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement. You will work in a cross functional setup, working closely with other analysts, engineers, scientists and marketing managers.

In This Role, You Will


Help us set the right goals: Develop clear and measurable targets based on an initiatives’ scope.
Be a strategic partner for Senior Leadership: Driving end to end high complexity analysis on a strategic level in which the business domain is critical to drive overall company success.
Stakeholder management: Be an internal go-to-person for your teams when it comes to data related questions.
Evaluate initiatives: Support Marketing experimentation & testing initiatives; design test plans, obtain cross-functional alignment, execute robust analysis, and deliver actionable insights. Share these learnings through clear documentation and concise and empathic communication.
Contribute to self-serve data platform: Help building the right analytics foundations ,by pairing up with technical peers, so our marketing teams can interact with data and extract the right insights themselves.
Provide monitoring tools: Build the dashboards your team looks at every week to make sure they are impacting our company OKRs.
Improve data literacy of organisation: Educate teams to become independent when it comes to data access and understanding function led training and team wide workshops to foster data driven culture.
Be part of our data-community: Collaborate with a broad range of analytics teams at N26 to utilise shared platforms, insights and innovations.


What You Need To Be Successful


5+ years of experience, within the Marketing or Product Analytics field.
Strong understanding of statistical methods used in the analysis of experimental and observational data.Highly experienced with SQL and Python/R for analytics
Experience working with one or more common data visualisation tools (Tableau, Metabase, Looker, Superset, etc)Good presentation skills and communication skills.
Having experience in high growth startups managing topics like lifecycle, marketing strategy, engagement or subscription would be a plus.
Experience with Customer Data Platforms (eg. Braze, Treasure Data) would be a plus.
Having experience in quantitative research would be a plus.
Having experience in fintech would be a plus.


What’s In It For You


Accelerate your career growth by joining one of Europe’s most talked about disruptors 🚀.
Employee benefits that range from a competitive personal development budget, work from home budget, discounts to fitness & wellness memberships, language apps and public transportation.
As an N26 employee you will have access to a Premium subscription on your personal N26 bank account. As well as subscriptions for friends and family members.
Vacation days vary depending on your location of work. Additional day of annual leave for each year of service.
A high degree of autonomy and access to cutting edge technologies - all while working with a friendly team of peers of diverse nationalities, life experiences and family statuses.
A relocation package with visa support for those who need it.


Who We Are

N26 has reimagined banking for today’s digital world. Technology and design empower everything we do and it’s how we are building the global banking platform the world loves to use.

We've eliminated physical branches, paperwork, and hidden fees for an elegant digital experience and supreme savings. Giving people the power to live and bank their way is what gets us out of bed in the morning and inspires the work that we do.

We are headquartered in Berlin with offices in multiple cities across Europe, including Vienna and Barcelona, and a 1,500-strong team of more than 80 nationalities.

Sounds good? Apply now for this position.

N26 is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At Bitly, we believe in the power of the link or scan - to start a conversation, build a relationship or grow a business. Our mission is to turn every interaction into a catalyst for connections. It’s what motivates us to help people share, promote and engage everywhere on the Internet. We do this by being relentlessly product-focused, fostering the free-flowing exchange of ideas, and inspiring people around the world to dream up new ways of using Bitly.

The Role

Bitly is seeking a skilled Data Engineer to join the Engineering team and be a key player in supporting our data infrastructure and pipeline. As a Data Engineer at Bitly, you will architect, build, and maintain infrastructure responsible for delivering data to our internal stakeholders. You will be a part of a global team that builds a Data Platform to not only provide Data into a global data warehouse but also support company wide tools with operational data.

Bitly supports every country in the world and every platform imaginable. Our systems are built to process an enormous amount of data. To support our scale, our infrastructure consists of hundreds of servers, dozens of services, and numerous real-time data streams.

What You'll Do


Write well-tested, well-documented code
Build major new services and improve existing ones
Create pipelines to move and transform data efficiently
Design flexible internal and external APIs to expose our data
Work with a variety of data tools like Apache Airflow, Bigquery, and Dataflow
Support our internal teams in maintaining and designing user tracking events
Mentor other engineers on best practices and implementation approaches


Who You Are


You have 2+ years of experience in data engineering
You are adept at clearly communicating technical concepts and ideas to other engineers and to other parts of the organization
You are an expert in SQL and have experience with at least one cloud SQL platform such as BigQuery or Redshift
You are fluent in Python
You are familiar with how web protocols, clients, and servers work
You take initiative in addressing issues or seeking support from fellow team members
Able to work on a remote team
Experience with Go (Golang)
Experience with Scrum
Experience with Apache Airflow and Apache Beam
Experience with BI and visualization tools
Experience with Terraform


What Bitly offers on Day 1!


Competitive Salary + Stock Options
30 days paid vacation
Flexible working location
Robust mental health support and Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Impactful connections and community building through our Employee Resource Groups
Global DEI programming
Company-sponsored events to connect Bitizens together


Eligibility & Closing

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in Germany on a full-time basis and located in Germany.

Compensation

The salary range for this role takes into account a wide range of factors considered in making compensation decisions including, but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications as well as other business and organizational needs.

Base Salary Range

€55.000—€75.900 EUR

Our Values


Be a Catalyst. As an innovative technology company, we build our products to be a catalyst for connection and encourage our team to be catalysts for meaningful impact both at work and in the world
Take Ownership. In our highly collaborative culture, Individual accountability is critical. We depend on each other to solve our customers' most challenging problems and celebrate the wins together
Champion Diversity, Equity & Inclusion. Our product connects people of all backgrounds and abilities. And our company is built on the belief that our differences make us better and that everyone deserves the opportunity in which to thrive
Show Integrity. We don’t cut corners. We don’t look for the easy way out. We approach every day with a shared mindset - let’s do the right thing, even if it’s the harder thing
Have Fun. Whether your time is here is as short as a Bitly link or as long as the links your grandma sends you, we want your experience at Bitly to be fun and memorable. We hope the connections you make here last a lifetime


In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination/harassment based on “protected categories,” Bitly also strives to prevent other, subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (e.g., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at Bitly.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Description Overview

Perrigo Company is dedicated to making lives better by bringing Quality, Affordable Self-care products that consumers trust everywhere they are sold. Help us do it.




As the Business Intelligence Manager you will play a pivotal role in owning data collection and reporting of the local business, being a critical partner to the Local and Cluster leadership team. Reporting to the Head of CS&I and BI DACH, you will partner with the local team to deliver best in business understanding for the local market.




Location: Can be based in our Vienna office/Stuttgart office or Germany remote




Scope of the Role

Enable delivery of Business Goals & Commercial Strategy for the Country

A key partner delivering data reporting to the local & cluster leadership team to support delivery of business goals
Primary responsibility to retrieve, combine, structure & summarise sales (sell in, sell out & DVRP) data from commercial teams, creating dynamic dashboards that show actionable insights
Collaboration with key stakeholders to gather requirements & understand business needs (Central, CS&I, marketing, Sales & key retailers, Data providers)

Develop Leading Business Intelligence Principles

Data partner for CS&I teams to support working through commercial challenges and opportunities
Data visualisation expert.
Create reports & dashboards through various tools, including but not limited to PowerBI & Excel that serve the business needs.
Interpret local & central systems, mapping data together to facilitate ‘One Perrigo’ source of truth across functions
Identify automation & process improvement opportunities, working with technical teams to implement solutions. Set up connections to underlying databases (e.g. SAP, Salesforce, IRI, Nielsen, IQVIA) & build data models that map sources together in a SQL Datawarehouse.

Build Capability & Enable Success

Optimise processes & tools for maximum efficiency and impact
Support local team in their transformation from Excel dependency to dynamic/visual dashboard capability, enabling more data-driven decision making. Provide local advice & coaching.
Lead deployment, training & adoption of deployed dashboards/reports, providing continuous improvement of user adoption & sophistication of insights
Proactive contributor across the CSCI Business Intelligence community contributing share & re apply
Key partner to the cluster, central and local CS&I community, working to build community capability




Experience Required

5 years+ experience of business analytics with data visualization building specific experience
Fluency in written and spoken English and German is essential
Preference for experience with IRI/Nielsen or other syndicated data sources
Preference for experience with sales force or alternative CRM system
Proven experience managing analytically rigorous corporate programs
Proven history of designing and building reports & dashboards in Microsoft Power BI, or other similar data visualisation tools




***Please send your CV in English***

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
rapidmail und MAILINGWORK sind zwei auf E-Mail-Marketing speziali­sierte Software-Anbieter aus Deutschland. Mit dem Zusammen­schluss beider Unternehmen im Januar 2024 unter einer Geschäfts­führung möchten wir Firmen jeder Größe genau das Tool bieten, das sie für erfolgreiches E-Mail-Marketing brauchen: Mit rapidmail ermöglichen wir vor allem kleineren Organisa­tionen professio­nelles Newsletter-Marketing ohne hohen Zeitaufwand. Dagegen konzentrieren wir uns mit MAILINGWORK dank umfangreicher Funktionen wie komplexer automatisierter Workflows vor allem auf den Enterprise-Bereich.

Beide Unternehmen gehören zur Positive Group, deren Ambition es ist, zum europäischen Marktführer für digitale Kunden­kommunikation zu werden.

Aufgaben

Du liebst es, komplexe Daten in verständliche und nützliche Informa­tionen zu verwandeln und daraus maßgebliche Entschei­dungen abzuleiten? Als Senior Data Analyst (m/w/d) hast Du die Chance, eine zentrale Rolle in unserem Unternehmen einzunehmen und die daten­getriebene Zukunft von rapidmail und MAILINGWORK aktiv zu gestalten. Werde Teil unseres großartigen Teams und trage maßgeblich zu unserem Erfolg bei!


Du definierst relevante Kennzahlen für das gesamte Unternehmen und einzelne Abteilungen in Absprache mit dem Data Officer der Positive Group.
Du stellst sicher, dass diese Kennzahlen korrekt erfasst und verarbeitet werden.
Du baust ein standardisiertes Berichtssystem auf und schaffst damit ein einheitliches Verständnis der Kennzahlen, ihrer Zusammenhänge und Auswirkungen.
Du arbeitest eng mit der Geschäftsführung zusammen, um messbare Ziele zu setzen und regelmäßig den Fortschritt zu überprüfen.
Du unterstützt andere Teammitglieder, insbesondere Teamleitungen, bei allen daten- und analysebezogenen Fragen.
Du förderst die datengetriebene Kultur im gesamten Unternehmen und setzt Dich aktiv dafür ein, dass Entscheidungen stets auf soliden Daten basieren.
Neben der strategischen Ausgestaltung bearbeitest Du mit deinem Team auch ad-hoc-Anfragen als Entscheidungsgrundlage.
Du erstellst kommerzielle Prognosen und aktualisierst sie regelmäßig.
Du führst und unterstützt einen Junior Data Analyst.


Profil


Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium in einem relevanten Bereich (z.B. Wirtschaft, Informatik, Mathematik) oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation.
Du bringst mindestens vier Jahre Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics mit.
Du besitzt herausragende analytische Fähigkeiten und kannst komplexe Probleme lösen.
Du schaffst es, komplexe Sachverhalte einfach zu visualisieren, anstatt dich in endlosen Tabellen zu verlieren.
Du beherrschst gängige Analysetools und Datenvisualisierungssoftware.
Du hast bereits erste Erfahrungen im Software-as-a-Service-Umfeld gesammelt.
Du besitzt ausgezeichnete Kommunikationsfähigkeiten.
Du sprichst fließend Deutsch, da dies unsere Unternehmenssprache ist und bringst gute Englischkenntnisse mit.


Wir bieten


Urlaub: 30 Tage, 32 Tage für Alleinerziehende
Mobiles Arbeiten: bis zu drei Tage die Woche von zuhause, im Garten oder wo auch immer Du gutes WLAN hast, arbeiten
Arbeitsvertrag: unbefristet
Büros: Getränke, Snacks und Eis, ergonomischer Arbeitsplatz
100 € Benefit-Budget: nutzbar für den ÖPNV, Essen, Kita, Gesundheitskurse und weitere Gutscheine
Workation: bis zu 30 Tage pro Jahr im EU-Ausland
betriebliche Altersvorsorge: 20 % Zuschuss von rapidmail
Weiterbildung: persönliches Weiterbildungsbudget in Höhe von 1.000 € pro Jahr
Kinderkrankentage: 5 bezahlte Kinderkranktage für alle Eltern


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

LNKD1_DE

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We are Gemma Analytics: a Berlin-based company specializing in generating insights in high-performance data infrastructure. Gemma was founded in early 2020 by two data enthusiasts. Ever since we have helped over 60 companies to become more data-driven and successful. We have a fun, honest, and inclusive work environment. We are always looking for data-minded people we can learn from.

Tasks

As a Senior Data Analyst, your mission is to empower businesses with data-driven insights and strategies that propel their growth and success. You do not accept a solution, but ask for the “Why?”. You will play a pivotal role in transforming data into actionable insights, enabling our clients to make informed and trusted judgments and gain an advantage in their respective industries.

In addition to that, you will contribute to the growth of our organization by mentoring and guiding associate data professionals and sharing your knowledge and expertise to foster their professional development. Furthermore, you will responsibly stay abreast of the latest industry trends and technologies, continuously nurturing your skills and providing thought leadership and support within our company.

By embracing this mission, you will help businesses unlock the potential of their data, driving tangible results, sharing your knowledge with colleagues, and enthusiastically nurturing decision-making in a rapidly evolving digital landscape.

Requirements

We believe in a good mixture of experience and upside in our team. For this role, related experience is required in addition to a proof of trajectory.

Besides That We Are Looking For The Following


2 or more years of experience as an analyst in a fast-paced environment driving projects and business insights
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability for critical thinking and reflection
Strong interpersonal and presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Proven ability to manage multiple projects, meet deadlines, and adapt to changing priorities
Ability to leverage both SQL and visualization tools to generate insights for our clients
Business Fluency (C2 or native) in German or English
Preferred: You managed to bring a data science model to production
Preferred: You have strong expertise in one or more core functional data areas (e.g. product/marketing/operational/etc.)


Benefits

We are located in Berlin, close to Nordbahnhof. We are currently 17 colleagues and will grow to 23 colleagues in the next 12 to 18 months. Other perks include:


We are a hybrid company that meets in the office twice a week - one common office day and one flexible day
We allow for intra-EU workcations for up to 3 months a year (extra-EU workcations also if this is allowed)
We have an honest, inclusive work environment and want to nurture this environment
We don’t compromise on equipment - a powerful Laptop, extra screens, and all the tools you need to be effective
We will surround you with great people who love to solve (mostly data) riddles
We believe in efficient working hours rather than long working hours - we focus on the output rather than the input
We learn and share during meetups, lunch & learn sessions and are open to further initiatives
We pay a market-friendly salary and we additionally distribute at least 20% of profits to our employees
We are fast-growing and have technology at our core, yet we do not rely on a VC and operate profitably
We have a great yearly offsite event that brings us all together for a full week, enjoying good food, and having a good time (2021: Austria, 2022: Czech Republic, 2023: Germany)


How You'll Get Here


CV Screening
Phone/Coffee/Tea Initial Conversation
Hiring Test
Interviews with 3 future colleagues
Reference calls
Offer + Hired
Show more

Title: Customer Data Analyst (Customer Segmentation) (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalando’s Markets organization, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer focussed analytics and segmentations we put our customers at the center of every marketing and retail decision. As a (Senior) Customer Data Analyst in our Customer Segmentation Team you are the closest link to our customer You build a deep understanding of our customer base by developing and analyzing different customer segments based on their purchasing behavior, interests, customer value and onsite activities. You will transform data and segmentations into actionable insights and recommendations that drive strategic decisions and customer retention.

WHAT WE’D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)



Develop and analyze customer segmentations and audiences, support targeting and steering initiatives to drive customer value and retention. Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to optimize and productionalize your segmentations and audience selections.
Design, conduct and evaluate A/B tests to optimize your segmentations and audiences according to their use case. Recommend testing strategies to optimize targeted campaigns, campaign efficiency and ultimately customer value and retention. Translate complex questions into sound analytical tasks, autonomously planning large scale projects.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify new strategic opportunities and recommend actions supporting the customer strategy. Present your findings and work closely with business stakeholders and product owners to operationalize your recommendations.
Drive data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members in terms of methodology & technology to raise the bar within the department. Collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers and commercial colleagues to untap new sources of data and know-how.
Independently manage analytical projects, identifying efficiency opportunities and supporting decision-making with insights from descriptive and inferential analysis.
Conduct knowledge-sharing sessions, support junior colleagues, and contribute to internal events and the hiring process.



WE’D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



You have 3+ years experience in using customer data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions and/or drive targeting efforts incl. model driven statistical analysis, e.g. Causal Inference. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science.
Advanced skills in data methodologies and technologies (Python and SQL, PySpark). Visualization tools, e.g. MicroStrategy, Tableau, PowerBI and versioning tools, e.g. Git/GitHub, are considered a plus. Curious about learning new technologies, e.g. Databricks, AWS data lake, Airflow.
Strong communicator to challenge the status-quo, tell data stories, maximize decision impact of your results and liaison with commercial and tech people alike.
Proactive, fast learner, problem solver, teamplayer, comfortable working in English in a fast paced international work environment



INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy

Our employee resource groups

https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Shipping Pricing
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

At Vinted, Shipping Pricing is a key channel to grow our platform by making high-stake investment decisions. We have a Decision Scientist opening in the Shipping Pricing area. As a Decision Scientist, you’ll join our Marketing Data Science & Analytics (Marketing DSA) team where a mix of talented people with backgrounds from academia, econometrics, e-commerce, consulting, and media apply a scientific approach to solve worldwide business problems. You will report to the Manager of Data Science & Analytics and work in the team of experienced Decision and Data Scientists.

In the Shipping Pricing domain, in addition to being a member of Marketing DSA, you’ll also become a member of the Shipping Pricing team – a key team driving Vinted Marketplace growth through shipping discount strategies. Your primary responsibility will be to enable the team to optimise our investments via experimentation (AB testing), in-depth data analysis, and creation of new ROI models. In this role, you will collaborate with analytics engineers, decision scientists, and pricing analysts to identify and fulfil data requirements in this area.

Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision-making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.


In this position, you’ll


Create High Impact: Contribute to the development of new ROI/ROAS and payback models to measure Shipping Discount campaigns’ performance
Always remain challenged: Investigate revenue streams that Shipping Pricing generates – think of acquisition, reactivation and engagement on both sides of a two-sided market, i.e. seller and buyer
Be involved: Analyse how shipping discount investments drive user acquisition and retention, engagement, and lifetime value
Raise Our Data Quality Standards: Drive the usage of data & analytics within the organisation by making the Shipping Pricing data obvious for everyone to understand, interpret, and use in daily decision-making
Co-create across Marketplace & DSA: Pitch your findings to your team as well as marketing or shipping pricing colleagues to pivot the models used to measure success


About You


Strong statistical, analytical, strategic, and business skills
Highly business-results-oriented and able to connect science with pragmatic problem-solving
A good communicator who can present results in an informative and persuasive manner to a wide range of stakeholders
Intermediate-to-extensive working experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, or Data Scientist
Experienced with AB testing and measuring causal relationships using advanced statistical methods
Strong knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Stata, Matlab etc.)
Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)
A graduate degree in statistics, econometrics, economics, business or a similar field
Excellent at communicating in written and spoken English
Advantage: Previous experience with Marketing Analytics, in particular, ROI/ROAS models
Advantage: Strong econometrics knowledge (statistical models, regression analyses)
Advantage: Advanced knowledge of R/Python


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 57,000 - € 85,300 gross per year.
Show more
HTML:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

At Vinted, Shipping Pricing is a key channel to grow our platform by making high-stake investment decisions. We have a Decision Scientist opening in the Shipping Pricing area. As a Decision Scientist, you’ll join our Marketing Data Science & Analytics (Marketing DSA) team where a mix of talented people with backgrounds from academia, econometrics, e-commerce, consulting, and media apply a scientific approach to solve worldwide business problems. You will report to the Manager of Data Science & Analytics and work in the team of experienced Decision and Data Scientists.

In the Shipping Pricing domain, in addition to being a member of Marketing DSA, you’ll also become a member of the Shipping Pricing team – a key team driving Vinted Marketplace growth through shipping discount strategies. Your primary responsibility will be to enable the team to optimise our investments via experimentation (AB testing), in-depth data analysis, and creation of new ROI models. In this role, you will collaborate with analytics engineers, decision scientists, and pricing analysts to identify and fulfil data requirements in this area.

Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:

  • Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision-making.
  • Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
  • Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.

In this position, you’ll

  • Create High Impact: Contribute to the development of new ROI/ROAS and payback models to measure Shipping Discount campaigns’ performance
  • Always remain challenged: Investigate revenue streams that Shipping Pricing generates – think of acquisition, reactivation and engagement on both sides of a two-sided market, i.e. seller and buyer
  • Be involved: Analyse how shipping discount investments drive user acquisition and retention, engagement, and lifetime value
  • Raise Our Data Quality Standards: Drive the usage of data & analytics within the organisation by making the Shipping Pricing data obvious for everyone to understand, interpret, and use in daily decision-making
  • Co-create across Marketplace & DSA: Pitch your findings to your team as well as marketing or shipping pricing colleagues to pivot the models used to measure success

About You

  • Strong statistical, analytical, strategic, and business skills
  • Highly business-results-oriented and able to connect science with pragmatic problem-solving
  • A good communicator who can present results in an informative and persuasive manner to a wide range of stakeholders
  • Intermediate-to-extensive working experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, or Data Scientist
  • Experienced with AB testing and measuring causal relationships using advanced statistical methods
  • Strong knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Stata, Matlab etc.)
  • Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)
  • A graduate degree in statistics, econometrics, economics, business or a similar field
  • Excellent at communicating in written and spoken English
  • Advantage: Previous experience with Marketing Analytics, in particular, ROI/ROAS models
  • Advantage: Strong econometrics knowledge (statistical models, regression analyses)
  • Advantage: Advanced knowledge of R/Python

Work perks

  • The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
  • 30 days of paid annual leave
  • Newest MacBook models
  • Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
  • Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
  • A daily lunch allowance
  • Frequent team-building events
  • A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
  • Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
  • Subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
  • A subsidised Deutschlandticket
  • The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
  • A dog-friendly office

Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 57,000 - € 85,300 gross per year.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Aufgabenspektrum

Mitarbeit im Aufbau, der Implementierung und Betreuung von prozessualer und kommerziell getriebener Analytik.
Unterstützung in der Konzeption, Implementierung und Weiterentwicklung von Reports mittels Microsoft Power BI und deren zugrundeliegende Datenaufbereitung.
Unterstützung in der Abstimmungen von reportingbezogenen Anforderungen und Ergebnissen mit unseren internen Auftraggebern und sowie in der Interpretation und Bewertung von Analysen.




Anforderungsprofil

Erfahrung im Business Intelligence Umfeld, idealerweise mit Controlling Hintergrund.
Energiewirtschaftliche Kenntnisse wären vorteilhaft aber nicht zwingend erforderlich.
Fundierte Kenntnisse im Rahmen der BI spezifischen Datenverarbeitung mit SQL sowie der Datenvisualisierung mittels Microsoft Power BI.
Idealerweise Erfahrung in der Nutzung von Databricks und dem Einsatz von Python im BI-Kontext.
Deutsch auf Muttersprachen-Niveau.

Title: Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Das erwartet dich bei uns

Als Data Analyst (w/m/d) bei Kess wirst du uns dabei unterstützen, durch datengetriebene Entscheidungsfindung Wettbewerbsvorteile zu erzielen und langfristig erfolgreich zu sein. Du verantwortest die systematische Erhebung, Aufbereitung und Auswertung von Website-, Produkt- und Konsumentendaten. Hierfür beziehst du Daten aus unterschiedlichsten Quellen ein und kümmerst dich um deren Aufbereitung in Form von Reportings und Dashboards. Deine Erkenntnisse präsentierst du unserem Managementteam und den Kanalverantwortlichen und leitest Handlungsempfehlungen ab.

Zusätzlich Kümmerst Du Dich Um Die


Beschaffung, Bereinigung und Analyse von Daten zur Identifizierung von Trends, Mustern und Korrelationen zur Ableitung von Handlungsempfehlungen
Erstellung und Visualisierung von Berichten und Dashboards für verschiedene Geschäftsbereiche, wie beispielsweise Marketing und Operations
Automatisierung von Prozessen und Reportingstrukturen zur Effizienzsteigerung und Qualitätssicherung der Datenanalyse
Kontinuierliche Sicherstellung und Monitoring der Datenqualität
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Stakeholdern, insbesondere dem CEO und unserem Managementteam, um Geschäftsentscheidungen zu unterstützen



Unsere Wünsche an dich


Ein abgeschlossenes Studium mit analytischem Schwerpunkt (z.B. BWL, Statistik, Informatik, Mathematik, etc.) oder vergleichbare Qualifikationen
Mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Data Analytics, idealerweise im E-Commerce und/oder Marketing
Hervorragende Kenntnisse in Excel, sicherer Umgang mit SQL und weitere Programmiersprachen sind von Vorteil
Erfahrung im Umgang mit großen Datenmengen (Data Warehouse, idealerweise BigQuery) sowie mit Visualisierungstools (z.B. Looker Studio, PowerBI, Tableau)
Starke analytische Skills und die Fähigkeit aussagekräftige Berichte und Dashboards zu gestalten
Sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und Spaß daran vor vielen Leuten deine Erkenntnisse zu präsentieren
Strukturiertes und eigeninitiatives Arbeiten gehört für dich dazu, du bist aber auch ein Teamplayer und versuchst gemeinsam mit dem Team Kess noch erfolgreicher zu machen
Fließende Englisch- und sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse



Das bieten wir dir


Rabatt auf unsere Produkte
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und hybrides Arbeitsmodell
30 Tage Urlaub und die Möglichkeit 25 Tage Remote (innerhalb EU) zu arbeiten pro Jahr
Corporate Benefits Plattform und die Möglichkeit auf ein Leasing-Bike
Freie Wahl des technischen Equipments (Windows / Mac) und ein modernes, hundefreundliches Büro mit idealer Verkehrsanbindung
Monatliche After-Work-Drinks und regelmäßige Teamevents
Ein dynamisches und offenes Arbeitsumfeld, mit transparenter Unternehmens- und Feedback-Kultur
Die Chance, Teil eines schnell wachsenden Unternehmens mit motivierten, internationalen Arbeitskollegen zu sein, in dem man Ideen einbringen und mitwirken kann
Show more

  • Sehr gute Kommunikationsfähigkeiten und Spaß daran vor vielen Leuten deine Erkenntnisse zu präsentieren
  • Strukturiertes und eigeninitiatives Arbeiten gehört für dich dazu, du bist aber auch ein Teamplayer und versuchst gemeinsam mit dem Team Kess noch erfolgreicher zu machen
  • Fließende Englisch- und sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse


Das bieten wir dir

  • Rabatt auf unsere Produkte
  • Flexible Arbeitszeiten und hybrides Arbeitsmodell
  • 30 Tage Urlaub und die Möglichkeit 25 Tage Remote (innerhalb EU) zu arbeiten pro Jahr
  • Corporate Benefits Plattform und die Möglichkeit auf ein Leasing-Bike
  • Freie Wahl des technischen Equipments (Windows / Mac) und ein modernes, hundefreundliches Büro mit idealer Verkehrsanbindung
  • Monatliche After-Work-Drinks und regelmäßige Teamevents
  • Ein dynamisches und offenes Arbeitsumfeld, mit transparenter Unternehmens- und Feedback-Kultur
  • Die Chance, Teil eines schnell wachsenden Unternehmens mit motivierten, internationalen Arbeitskollegen zu sein, in dem man Ideen einbringen und mitwirken kann

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Title: Financial Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Deine Aufgaben:


Du entwickelst eine neue Prozessmodellierung für Finanzdaten und baust sie auf
Dabei erstellst du neue Dashboards und Auswertungen zur Datenanalyse und visualisierst Trends
Du bringst dein Erfahrungswissen bei Entscheidungsgrundlagen für das Management ein und bereitest diese vor
Du wirkst aktiv bei der Implementierung neuer Applikationen und Tools mit und bist für die erforderliche Anpassung von Geschäftsprozessen mitverantwortlich
Deine Expertise bringst du proaktiv bei der Aufbereitung verschiedener finanzrelevanter Projekte ein
In direkter Berichtslinie arbeitest du eng mit unserem Vice President Finance & Admin zusammen


Dein Profil:


Du verfügst über ein abgeschlossenes Studium in einem wirtschaftswissenschaftlichen Bereich vorzugsweise mit dem Schwerpunkt Finanzen oder über eine abgeschlossene kaufmännische Ausbildung
Du bist erfahren in der Erstellung von Reports und Präsentationen (mittels BI Tools und MS Office)
Deine Argumentationssicherheit basiert auf Zahlen, Daten & Fakten
Du bist eine eigenständige und selbstorganisierte Arbeitsweise gewohnt, dabei aber ein Teamplayer
Du bringst Passion und Freude an der Analyse und Auswertung von Daten und digitalen Lösungen mit
Kommunikationsstärke und eine ausgeprägte Service- und Kundenorientierung zeichnen dich aus
Du verfügst über gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse (mind. B2-Niveau)


Freu Dich drauf:


30 Tage Urlaub sowie Heiligabend und Silvester frei
44 Euro Beitrag zum Deutschlandticket
Vermögenswirksame Leistungen in Höhe von 27 Euro pro Monat
Essenszuschuss von bis zu 20 Euro pro Woche für Foodji
Flexibles Arbeiten mit der Option, mehrere Tage pro Woche im Homeoffice zu arbeiten
Persönliches Wachstum durch Weiterbildungen und Gestaltungsfreiraum
Eine strukturierte Einarbeitung mit bereichsübergreifenden Netzwerkveranstaltungen
Ein zukunftsweisendes Unternehmen mit familiärer Unternehmenskultur
Einzigartige Teamevents, z.B. Grillevents, Weihnachtsfeier und das große AVM Sommerfest, zu dem auch deine Familie miteingeladen ist

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are seeking an organised and self-motivated Data Analyst to work embedded in our Marketing Data team, one of our cross-functional Data teams to help shape the development of one of the world's leading FinTech products.

As a Senior Data Analyst you will enable our Marketing team to make data-driven decisions. You will monitor, measure and analyse the effectiveness of your marketing teams’ initiatives, as well as help drive the strategy of your stakeholder teams. You are here to establish a data-mindset and thereby to foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement. You will work in a cross functional setup, working closely with other analysts, engineers, scientists and marketing managers.

In This Role, You Will


Help us set the right goals: Develop clear and measurable targets based on an initiatives’ scope.
Be a strategic partner for Senior Leadership: Driving end to end high complexity analysis on a strategic level in which the business domain is critical to drive overall company success.
Stakeholder management: Be an internal go-to-person for your teams when it comes to data related questions.
Evaluate initiatives: Support Marketing experimentation & testing initiatives; design test plans, obtain cross-functional alignment, execute robust analysis, and deliver actionable insights. Share these learnings through clear documentation and concise and empathic communication.
Contribute to self-serve data platform: Help building the right analytics foundations ,by pairing up with technical peers, so our marketing teams can interact with data and extract the right insights themselves.
Provide monitoring tools: Build the dashboards your team looks at every week to make sure they are impacting our company OKRs.
Improve data literacy of organisation: Educate teams to become independent when it comes to data access and understanding function led training and team wide workshops to foster data driven culture.
Be part of our data-community: Collaborate with a broad range of analytics teams at N26 to utilise shared platforms, insights and innovations.


What You Need To Be Successful


5+ years of experience, within the Marketing or Product Analytics field.
Strong understanding of statistical methods used in the analysis of experimental and observational data.Highly experienced with SQL and Python/R for analytics
Experience working with one or more common data visualisation tools (Tableau, Metabase, Looker, Superset, etc)Good presentation skills and communication skills.
Having experience in high growth startups managing topics like lifecycle, marketing strategy, engagement or subscription would be a plus.
Experience with Customer Data Platforms (eg. Braze, Treasure Data) would be a plus.
Having experience in quantitative research would be a plus.
Having experience in fintech would be a plus.


What’s In It For You


Accelerate your career growth by joining one of Europe’s most talked about disruptors 🚀.
Employee benefits that range from a competitive personal development budget, work from home budget, discounts to fitness & wellness memberships, language apps and public transportation.
As an N26 employee you will have access to a Premium subscription on your personal N26 bank account. As well as subscriptions for friends and family members.
Vacation days vary depending on your location of work. Additional day of annual leave for each year of service.
A high degree of autonomy and access to cutting edge technologies - all while working with a friendly team of peers of diverse nationalities, life experiences and family statuses.
A relocation package with visa support for those who need it.


Who We Are

N26 has reimagined banking for today’s digital world. Technology and design empower everything we do and it’s how we are building the global banking platform the world loves to use.

We've eliminated physical branches, paperwork, and hidden fees for an elegant digital experience and supreme savings. Giving people the power to live and bank their way is what gets us out of bed in the morning and inspires the work that we do.

We are headquartered in Berlin with offices in multiple cities across Europe, including Vienna and Barcelona, and a 1,500-strong team of more than 80 nationalities.

Sounds good? Apply now for this position.

N26 is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Title: Lead Data Analyst (d/f/m) Salesforce
Description:
Benefits:


Opportunity to use top-notch technology within the ad-tech industry.
3 months onboarding program to get to know the other starters and all the departments.
Mentor program to ensure your further development within the company.
International teams with a strong focus on innovation, feedback and fun.
Hybrid workplace policy: Come to the brand new office in the heart of Berlin or work from home.
EU workation program: Join your colleagues to work in one of their coworking venues in Spain or Croatia.
Monthly lunch club and quarterly after work events.
German and English language classes with teachers onsite in Berlin and Spain as well as tandem language learning program.
30 days vacation.
Health insurance package.
Urban Sports Club membership or Lunch vouchers.
BVG transportation ticket.


Responsibilities:


You help the team to understand the connection between their analytics and the business context.
As an expert in data analytics, you challenge existing practices and identify areas for improvement.
You are responsible for monthly and quarterly reporting, supporting sales and other marketing stakeholders for their strategic decisions.
You improve reports and dashboards to track KPIs related to market performance and campaign effectiveness.
You define and extract valuable insights from complex marketing datasets and hold presentations about it.


Your profile:


Minimum of 5 years work experience in data analytics.
Minimum of 2 years of work experience in a role that holds presentations about key findings in data analytics.
Have been involved in strategic decision making.
Experienced with visualization tools.
Proficient in Excel.
Proficient with extracting data from & data analytics with Salesforce.
Experience with A/B testing, marketing budget optimization, user acquisition, conversion/purchase prediction, recommendation system, marketing mix modelling (MMM), attribution, bidding automation, lift tests, or geo tests.


Please send your CV to Nathalie; if you have any questions feel free to call/Whatsapp/Signal/Telegram/SMS: +4915733914408.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Description Overview

Perrigo Company is dedicated to making lives better by bringing Quality, Affordable Self-care products that consumers trust everywhere they are sold. Help us do it.




As the Business Intelligence Manager you will play a pivotal role in owning data collection and reporting of the local business, being a critical partner to the Local and Cluster leadership team. Reporting to the Head of CS&I and BI DACH, you will partner with the local team to deliver best in business understanding for the local market.




Location: Can be based in our Vienna office/Stuttgart office or Germany remote




Scope of the Role

Enable delivery of Business Goals & Commercial Strategy for the Country

A key partner delivering data reporting to the local & cluster leadership team to support delivery of business goals
Primary responsibility to retrieve, combine, structure & summarise sales (sell in, sell out & DVRP) data from commercial teams, creating dynamic dashboards that show actionable insights
Collaboration with key stakeholders to gather requirements & understand business needs (Central, CS&I, marketing, Sales & key retailers, Data providers)

Develop Leading Business Intelligence Principles

Data partner for CS&I teams to support working through commercial challenges and opportunities
Data visualisation expert.
Create reports & dashboards through various tools, including but not limited to PowerBI & Excel that serve the business needs.
Interpret local & central systems, mapping data together to facilitate ‘One Perrigo’ source of truth across functions
Identify automation & process improvement opportunities, working with technical teams to implement solutions. Set up connections to underlying databases (e.g. SAP, Salesforce, IRI, Nielsen, IQVIA) & build data models that map sources together in a SQL Datawarehouse.

Build Capability & Enable Success

Optimise processes & tools for maximum efficiency and impact
Support local team in their transformation from Excel dependency to dynamic/visual dashboard capability, enabling more data-driven decision making. Provide local advice & coaching.
Lead deployment, training & adoption of deployed dashboards/reports, providing continuous improvement of user adoption & sophistication of insights
Proactive contributor across the CSCI Business Intelligence community contributing share & re apply
Key partner to the cluster, central and local CS&I community, working to build community capability




Experience Required

5 years+ experience of business analytics with data visualization building specific experience
Fluency in written and spoken English and German is essential
Preference for experience with IRI/Nielsen or other syndicated data sources
Preference for experience with sales force or alternative CRM system
Proven experience managing analytically rigorous corporate programs
Proven history of designing and building reports & dashboards in Microsoft Power BI, or other similar data visualisation tools




***Please send your CV in English***

Show more
